column2: Heather, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on methotrexate pills and injections, enbrel, humira, remicade, and a couple of others I don't even remember the names of. I was 14 when I was diagnosed, and didn't get any results until I was 17 and was put on Remicade, which worked wonders, but I developed a very bad allergy to it, so   my doctor put me on Simponi. It works very well for the first 2 and a half to three weeks of use, but the last week or so it wears off and I have pain and stiffness again. I will say that in between stopping Remicade and starting Simponi, I had severe psoriatic athritis in more than 20 joints and couldn't walk, now, I am almost a normal college student! I'll also add, however, that I have chronic MRSA infections, which didn't occur until I went on this medication. Taken care of by my derm, to be honest it is worth it to be able to walk!

column2: kristi, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I love that I only have to inject once every four weeks, because I hate injections.  And the duration of the injection is only a couple seconds.  It doesn't sting much during the injection.  I haven't had any injection site reactions (I did with Enbrel).  However, the effectiveness of this drug is not as impreesive as Enbrel was.  I have Psoriatic Athritis and Psoriasis.  The arthritic pain is still there, although not as bad as without the medicine, and I've had a couple flare-ups, which I never had on Enbrel.  The Psoriasis is mostly gone, but there are some persistant spots.  I wish this drug was stronger, or perhaps was done every two or three weeks.

column2: roxiebum3, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had RA for 3 years now. My doctor and I have probably tried about everything including methotrexate,leflunomide,meloicam, indomethacin, sulfasalazin. Also Humaria, Embrel and now Simponi nothing is helping me with the swelling, hurting all the time. Never stops. Any body got any suggestion.

column1: Rheumatic Disease causing Pain &amp; Stiffness in Backbone
column2: gwd, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Have ankylosing spondylitis with addition low back pain (L4/L5) due to accident. Was on remicade for 7 years with morphine short term and extended relief. Much better control with change to simponi and hydromorphone immediate release and extended   release. 80-90% improvement in daily life.

column2: erickson12, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've tried many other types of injection-based arthritis treatments with little help.  I've been on this for 4 months and had almost immediate help in almost eliminating the pain.  However, it only helps for about 2 1/2 weeks, and I can only get the injection every 4 weeks, so I'm still looking for solutions to extend the benefit, but after a this short trial period I am very happy with the results.  I have had no side effects related to this medication either, which is great for me, because anything that causes drowsiness really hits me hard, so my choices are limited.

column2: Lcover, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Simponi for one year and it has been working well. I tend to be a little achy in the last week before the next injection.  It seems to have helped the osteoarthritis in my thumbs as well. It took about 6 months before I really noticed a difference. I haven't had any noticeable side effects at this time. I switched from the auto injector pen to the syringe.  With the syringe I know that I am getting the correct dosage. I sometimes wondered if I was with the auto injector. Methotrexate unfortunately gave me a lung infection & Enbrel had me feeling horrible. So far I have been pleased with Simponi.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This drug works well for me,I have mild RA,I no longer experience swelling in morning & find that my hands work better.  On the last week before I inject I do experience some small difficulties just to let me know that I have RA.  Overall I am well.

column2: june k, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i feel a month is to long between injections i feel much better for the first two week and then it all gose down hill.the pen is very good no pain on injection site. my ra is bad and i will have to go back to the dr. to discuss another treatment. been on simponi for four months now and i dont think it is working for me

column2: Maryd43, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have tried Humira, Remicade ,Arava and none of them were effect I was on Enbrel which worked exceptional well but I had to change insurance and it would no longer pay for it so my Dr put me on simponi and it has worked very well

column2: vazquez069, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 40 year old woman was DX when i was 39  with RA and it hit me like a storm .I have osteo arthritis, rheumatoid arthritis ,high BP, heart condition, and diverticular disease so I was so scared to try simponi but I did because the swelling on my elbows, knees and hands and not to mention the pain was crazy. well simponi is a wonder drug alright and it gave me back control over my body. I really hate to take the pain killers like vicodin ES and the muscle relaxers , I have kids and i need to be alert and simponi gives me  great relief without the HIGH.

column2: java7, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Been on everything on the books for RA for past 14yrs and Simponi has worked fairly well until recently. Have gone from 3 1/2 wks relief to just about a week and a half at most & back to adding Celebrex x2day. Never had any lumps in armpit as on reader posts but massive welt from time to time at injection site.

column2: Pain under control, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This medication is beneficial, Easy to use and my pain is under control. I was diagnose with ankylosis Spondilitis, Dec 2001 after a year of search by my wonderfull Dr. that did not give up on me. I worked till my retirement this year. I started on Simponi this February with no side effect, but it took 3 treatment before it made effect. I was on Viox, Celebrex, Naprelan ect. After I was on Remicade for 24 perfusions 1 every 6 weeks till a rejection and bad allergy in Nov 2010. Remicade was great as a pain control for the time my body accepted it. Simponi is great but it is hard to get the autoinjection, only the injection has been available for the last 6 months.

column2: Selinak, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed w/RA back in '94. I was on Humira which was virtually ineffective for me. My MD put me on Methotrexate and Simponi and I've been taking it for the last 4 mos. I do feel much better but the other day I just noticed a large lump under my armpit which was not there before and I am nervous about it. I'm waiting for my doctor to see me. Has anyone noticed anything like this?

column2: k j butter, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I also only had 1 injection and experienced oral sores inside and then after they healed, broke out all over my lip and chin with terrible fever blisters.  I have never had either problem in my life until now. age 50

column2: alee.martin, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was changed to Simponi from Humaira 3 months ago. I am also still on Methotrexate. It is very likely to soon to make a judgement but I am not seeing any relief. Fortunately I am not having any adverse effects. I know there is no miracle. I could just use some relief....

column2: on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I have been taking Simponi for about 6 months for AS and have not had any improvement.  I have to take 600 mg of Ibuprophin and Tramadal at least 3-4 times a day for the pain.

column2: megan, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was dx with Ankylosing Spondolyitis about 3 yrs ago and have been thru all other meds.  Recently my pharmacy was unable to get the simponi, so I have been 2 months w/o for the first time since I started it 1 year ago.  I certainly notice a difference!  The only thing is that my husband says that I am a "different person" personality wise now than when I am on it.  Has anyone else noticed an emotional/personality changes while taking it?  I also seem to have more problems keeping on task and paying attention to details while I am not on it.  Am I just crazy?  It's such a difference that he asked me not go back on it and seek out something else.

column2: Pontiac26, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken now 4 doses and over night with the first injection I felt totally better. I also take 2 other RA meds on a regular basis but this Simponi is wonderful. I have had RA since 1992.

column2: JTokar1, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After a few months I began to realize that I felt better in my day to day life.

column2: ERAM, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Works for a week or so and then the pain returns. Just found out through my Dr. that there has been a recall on the injectors since they were not dispensing the full dose of meds. Will try the syringe before giving up.

column2: Beck, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: its probably great for most people,alot of the meds dont work for me

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: THIS MEDICATION IS GREAT FOR 3 WEEKS AND THEN THE PAIN/STIFFNESS COMES BACK, I HAVE BEEN TAKING METHO TO SUPPLEMENT. NOW I AM GETTING LESIONS, COULD THIS BE DUE TO THE MIXING OF DRUGS??

column2: ktinker, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took my first injection of Simponi two weeks ago.  Within 30 seconds of the injection I had tingling of my tongue and rapid heart rate.  The tingling spread to my lips and face.  I had brief episodes of dizziness. My blood pressure increased. Our roads were iced over, so I spoke with the doctor who told me to monitor my blood pressure.  It would come in waves.  After about four hours I stabilized.  I have had brief episodes of dizziness over the past two weeks (5 seconds or so at a time).  Friday my blood pressure again increased from my normal rate of 125/69 to 189/90, I felt short of breath, nauseated and my face was flushed. My BP would stabilize and spike.  I went to the ER, was administered aspirin and something for nausea. My tests were all normal.  They released me when my BP became normal for several hours. Saturday night I had one episode of spiking BP.  Other than this issue the Simponi is working well.  It's so confusing.  Simponi is the only new medication I have taken in the past six months.  I was diagnosed 15  years ago and have been on Humira, Enbrel, and placquenil (with no side-effects). I am currently on methotrexate and Simponi. Has anyone had this experience with Simponi?

column2: Pattyr, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken this drug for 3 months and have itching on my back only and have developed white colored (2) lesions looking like basal cell and seeing my Dermatologist this week for both items.

column2: DACC, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Here is an update, I still feel fine yet thumb joint hurts a little and wrist. My doc and a ER doc (long story) agree that Simponi raise my BP to stage 2 level. The ER could bearly bring it down. This happens with a drug induce BP. High blood pressure is one of the symptoms, that is low on the list for side effects. It almost killed me. I was 25 points away from having a stroke. I had slight high BP before Simponi, but that was because I was on a steroid at the time and my Rummy did not wait for me to get off it first. So if you have high BP, I would think about the risk big time. I am now 2 weeks off drug and my BP is slowly coming down. How much did my BP go up? More then 50 points in a least 5 days. Rummy office 150/ 90 and 5 days later 210/112.My rummy wants me to take another drug for BP so I can take Simponi. YA Right. Take a drug to take a drug. Good Luck to those who are thinking about Simponi.

column1: Rheumatic Disease causing Pain &amp; Stiffness in Backbone
column2: crzysoup, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Diagnosed with Ankylosing Spondylitis & used Embrel 2 yrs, Humera 6 mos, Remecade 4 yrs & now Simponi 7 mos. For me the Simponi is WONDERFUL!!! It starts working within 2 days and lasts almost the full month instead of 3 weeks like the other drugs did. My range of motion is greater and I have less pain unless I over-do (which in itself a miracle that hasn't happened in a LONG time - imagine - me, over-doing it! I usually can't even DO it - let alone "over-do" it!)

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
DACC, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had my first injection on 18 Oct 2010, overnite pain was gone. I have had RA for over 15 yrs and the only drug I have done is Humira for 1 1/2. It wane out. I got my first shot from my doc for free to see what might happen. The only complaint is it rose my blood pressure way up and that caused headaches. Now the weird part is I not going to get another shot due to these reasons. Yet it has been a month and I still feel great. I think it might have sent me into a remission or something. Wil tell after 2 more weeks. Try to post an updat then.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have ankylosing spondylitis and have tried enbrel, orencia, remicade, rituxan and every anti inflammatory known to man. I started simponi on 10/28/10. I had 5 really great days,then it stopped. Now I am really frustrated. I will continue for another couple of months  but have little hope that this will work for any length of time. Given the cost benefit ratio not sure it is worth it. Wish it were as I am near the end of my rope. 62 and trying to work but it is not easy.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed 5 yrs ago.  Previously I was taking Enbrel for about 2 years, but it was no longer effective. I am very satisfied with the results of Simponi.  I still have some morning stiffness, but it is so much better than before. I also take Diclofenac 100mg(daily) and Methotrexate 2.5mg(wkly).

column2: trailfilly@gmail.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had RA since I was 39 and now i,am 52. been thru all the meds, humira, enbrel,remicade,ect.have been on Simponi only 1 month. I have mouth sores really bad at the moment.corners first started breaking out and then outside sores. They hurt and look gross. was wondering has anyone else had this problem and wonder if its the simponi are something else. I have to take my next shot next week and am scared to if this is what is happening to me. Please, let me know if anyone else has had this mouth sore problem. Thanks

column2: psttyf, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: What a difference! I was diagnosed 3 yrs ago. I am taking plaquenil and sulfasalzine. I have tried Humera and Enbrel. I just had my second dose of Simponi and have noticed a huge difference. I am feeling so much better. I still have difficult days, but the good days are increasing. I urge you to talk to your Doc about this wonder drug.

column2: Brian L, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Simponi for 3 months now and have been mostly pain free from the first day I took it.  I had had so much pain in my shoulders that I could not sleep even with even with all the narcotics I tried.  I have slept very well since the day I started Simponi.  My wrists, hands, and knees are also greatly improved.  I have gone from 150 Tylenol 3's a month to 30.  The only reaction I have had is slightly raised blood pressure.  So far every injection has lasted the full month, as advertised.  I still can not work but Simponi has given my day to day life back to me, pain free.  Some mornings I have a little stiffness in my shoulders and hands, but that is usually gone in an hour or so.  I also take 20mg Arava every other day and 75mg SR Diclofenac and 400mg Plaquenil daily.  It is unbelievable how such a small dose of medication can make such a huge difference!!  I am absolutely thrilled with the way  it has worked for me.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: has anyone had trouble with there eyes hurting?

column2: fishinchris, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have ankylosing spondylitis for 4 yrs with no relief except morphine. This is my 4th injection and I can feel a difference in my hands and feet not as swollen as usual.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am a 41 yr old who has suffered 12 yrs with severe PA (psoriatic arthritis). Simponi has been the only drug so far that has truly helped my symptoms.  I do not have flare-ups anymore after one year on the shots. I am suppose to be taking it in conjunction with methotrexate to keep my psoriasis in check; however, I feel so badly after taking the methotrexate that I discontinued it.  Therefore, I still have trouble with my psoriasis but the arthritis is so much better.  I feel like I gained a new life back!  I teach school so I am on my feet all day.  I had a much better school year this past year.  I feel the gains outweigh the risks as I have struggled with constant flare-ups.

column2: Major Sue, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Diagnosed in 2004 with aggressive RA and had been thru Embrel and Humira, (along with Planquenil, celebrex and methtrezate...etc.) but was still having rapid joint breakdowns requiring surgery to repair.  Found out via daughter I also have anlylosing spondilitis (AS-am HLA-B27 Pos) which my doc things has been active for 30 years.  Went on Simoponi April 5, 2009.  After 2 months I could wear my wedding band again.  I have a much lower incidence of rheumatoid fatigue (down from several days a week to one or 2 days during 2-3 weeks.)  Still flare occasionally, but a methylprednisone dose pack usually is enough extra to settle the joint back down.  To me this drug is a big improvement..I only hope it keeps working as well. I was close to the wheelchair when we caught all this.  Because of the drugs--the many many drugs--and proper gym work, I have done a breast cancer walk, and last weekend certified as an open water scuba diver.  Better living thru chemistry!

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
ernestwife, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: started 11/09 instant pain relief that lasted about two weeks with the first shot and have worked longer as my treatment progresses, However I have noticed in the when the weather is damp or cold the pain is less but is still there. No side effects so far and has definitely controlled my symptoms better than where I was.

column2: jburt, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is my third injection and it was painless unlike embrel.So far it has working just fine I haven't had any flare ups even though I get tired while walking because my feet hurt. Overall I really think its helping me.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: 47 year old woman with Ra for 29 years, on methotrexate for about 5 years. I was having daily joint pains and flare ups. After 24 hours I noticed a huge difference. I am on my feet 15 hours a day working and it is such a relief now. I have had no side affects.

column2: P. Smith, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My psoriasis started to clear about 3 days after injection. The pain associated with my psoriatic arthritis and ankylosing spondilytis went away, but returned. My doctor said it takes 2 weeks to take full effect. I have had a few side effects. It has been effective except for a few times. I am pleased with this medication so far because I have days where I feel like I did 2 years ago.

column2: debbypri, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i ma a 43 year old woman with ra i had my first dose of simponi january 4, 2010 it worked very well with in 3 days i felt like a new person and was able to do things pain free for the first time in more then a year then on january 22, 2010 about 19 days after my first dose i started feeling alot of pain again is it possible to be pain free that quick and then start feeling bad 19 days later please help

column2: mary.52, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken 4 injections since I started on Simponi.  I am very pleased with the pain relief I have received by using this medication.  However, usually about three days after injection, I develop several large red areas that look somewhat like hives, except they are very sensitive to touch and cause me to have to take other medications to relieve the itching.  During this time I also am very sick to my stomach.  I don't throw up, I just feel bad.  I am symptom free for only aboout 10 days out of the month, but I am very happy with the pain relief.

column2: slz, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I just started Simponi on November 19, 2009.  I am 46 years old and have had Rheumatoid Arthritis for 36 of those years.  I have been on alot of different medications during that time.  Including Enbrel, Remicade and Orencia.  None of them have worked like Simponi has for me.  I gave myself my first injection and felt almost immediate relief.  I couldn't believe it!  I am really excited about Simponi!!

column2: Beeper, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Simponi since July 09 (now Dec. 09), in conjunction with Methotrexate.  Prior to July 09, just doing the grocery store was really difficult.  My feet in particular have been quite affected by the RA.  However, now I can do everything I was able to before all of this started (in the spring of 2008).  No problems with the Simponi injections, no reaction issues - just relief from the dreadful joint pain in my feet, knees, shoulders, and neck.

column2: slwr2000, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have just sarted taking this drug and started feeling good by the time I got home from the doctor office. The next day was even better. I am very pleased with this medicine so far and from the reviews it will stay that way. So far good after 3 days.

column2: Nancyexpressinc, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only had one shot, but within 24 hrs I had no more pain. On a scale of 1-10, with one being the least, I was @ a 5 all the time. I am hoping to reduce other medications that I was already taking, since I am on Simponi. I start reducing Prednisone with my 2nd shot. I am so pleased and I pray that I can get off all other medication.

column2: steerland, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been diagnose with rheumatoid arthritis for seven years now, this drug seems to controll most of my symtoms.I have been on this for six months now.Tom

column2: lizhemsm, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The first month I got a yeast infection after 4 days, month 2 I got another yeast infection then I started itching and burning all over my body. If I scratched a spot it welted up but then went away if I stopped scratching that area. 12 days into the 2nd shot and I am still itching all over my body and welting up. I am living on benadril and pretty miserable. My skin is very sensitive and hurts if I put any pressure on my skin it burns and hurts. My hands are the worst, even washing them makes them burn because you use a towel to dry them.
